article.title: Aimaq_people
article.paragraph: TheAimaq(lang-faایماق), also transliterated asAimakorAymaq, are a collection ofPersian languagePersian-speakingnomadicand semi-nomadic tribes.Tom Lansford -A bitter harvest: US foreign policy and Afghanistan2003 Page 25 "The term Aimaq means "tribe" but the Aimaq people actually include several different ethnic groups. The classification has come to be used for a variety of nonaligned nomadic tribes"Aimaqs are found mostly throughoutPakistanmostly in the Kyber and Balochistan region and in the West CentralHighland (geography)highlandsofAfghanistan, immediately to the north ofHerat, and also to a much lesser amount in theKhorasan ProvinceofIran.cite encyclopediaJanataA.[[Ehsan Yarshater]][[Encyclopædia Iranica]]AYMĀQhttp://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/aymaq-turkOnline[[Columbia University]]United StatesThey speak a number of subdialects of theAimaq dialectofPersian languagePersian, however some southern groups ofTaymaniand Maleki Aymaqs have adoptedPashto languagePashto.Cite bookThe AfghansVogelsangWillem2002Wiley-Blackwell063119841518http://books.google.com.pk/books?id23 January 2012

Aimaks were originally known aschahar("four") Aymaqs: the Taimani (the main element in the population ofGhor), theFirozkohi, theTemuri, and theJamshidi (tribe)Jamshidi. Other sources state that theAimaq Hazaraare one of theChahar, with the Temuri instead being of the "lesser Aimaqs" orAimaq-e digarcite bookWillem VogelsangThe Afghanshttps://books.google.com/books?id1 April 20112002Wiley-Blackwell978063119841337–("other Aimaqs") along with the Tahiri, Zuri, Maleki, and Mishmast.
article.heading: Origin and classification
article.paragraph: Aimaks are closely related toTjik peopleTajiksandHazara peopleHazarasin varying degrees. In the Afghancensus, Aimaks are classified as Tajiks.Aimak, Ghor province on NPSAimaks live in parts of western and central Afghanistan, making up the majority inGhor ProvinceGhor, and also live in large numbers in the western areas ofHerat ProvinceHeratandBadghis ProvinceBadghis, and to a lesser extent inFarah ProvinceFarah,Faryab ProvinceFaryab,Jowzjan ProvinceJowzjan, andSar-e Pol ProvinceSar-e Pol. The word "Aymq" is Mongolian meaning "tribe" or "grazing territory". Aimaq Hazara andTaimuriare mostMongoloidof the Aimaqs. The Temuri and Aimaq Hazaras live inyurts, whereas other Aimaqs live in traditional Afghan black tents.http://www.tribalanalysiscenter.com/PDF-External/Hazara%20Baluchistan.pdf A SOCIOLOGICAL STUDY OF THE HAZARA TRIBE IN BALUCHISTAN (AN ANALYSIS OF SOCIO-CULTURAL CHANGE)
article.heading: Demographics
article.paragraph: FurtherDemographics of AfghanistanEthnic groups in AfghanistanFile:Afghanistan ethnic groups 2005.jpgthumbright300pxCIA map showing the territory of the settlement ofethnic groups in Afghanistanethnic groups and subgroups in Afghanistan(2005)Estimates of the Aimaq population vary between 250,000 and 0.5 million. They are largelySunniMuslims, in contrast to the Hazara, who are mostlyShias. The Temuri Aimaqs are of Mongolian origin, apparent in their physical appearance and their housing (Mongolian-styleyurts)."Afghanistan". Encyclopdia Britannica. Ultimate Reference Suite. Chicago: Encyclopdia Britannica, 2008.However, the Taimanis, Ferozkohis, and Jamshidis are of Iranian origin, and refer to themselves as Tajik; the majority of the Aimaqs in Afghanistan are of these latter three sub-groups.
